HARDCODING SUBS: Download mkv2vob (http://www.mkv2vob.com/showthread.php?tid=1), a simple GUI that will hardcode the subs, creating an MPEG file.
1) Browse to select the MKV file for Source.
2) Configuration tab - select Always Encode Subtitles. Also helps to select Overscan Compensation - which moves the subtitles a little above the bottom margin of the screen.
2a) If the subs are from a separate file (ie downloaded from allsubs.org or elsewhere), have it in the same folder as FILE.mkv, named FILE.srt, and select "Load subtitles from file" and it'll be used.
3) Back on the Add File tab, click Add File to start the process.

You only need VlC to play MKV unless you have a crap graphics card that doesnt play HD. If you have the crap graphics card option and codecs dont work and you still get lag.... your pc is crap. simple answer.

@ Zoran123: It's not that your "monitor" is slow, 1080p movies take ALOT of processor, 3ghz dual core or higher. You don't have enough cpu, and/or your system isn't configured properly to offload part of the rendering to your video card.

The third file on the list is the subtitle file you need; download it and unzip it then tell your video player to load that subtitle file. You now have the alien and African subtitles.
